business.headline: JP Morgan and ISG partner to bring ONDC seller app at Global Fintech Fest 2024The partnership creates a 'one stop shop' solution for digital commerce by leveraging ISG's ONDC tech stack, powered by its ecosystem partner Protean, and the banking capabilities of JP Morgan in India.

India's IPO frenzy: Why companies are rushing to go publicIn the first half of 2024, while global IPO markets cooled, India's IPO market has been on fire, bucking the trend seen in the US, Japan, and even China.

India's Q1 GDP grows at 6.7%, lowest in 5 quartersQ1 GDP growth: While the 6.7% growth is broadly in line with what experts had estimated, it falls short of the Reserve Bank of India's (RBI) projection of 7.2% for the same period.
ITR e-verification: You will have to pay penalty if...If you miss the 30-day window to e-verify, the date you finally verify your ITR will be considered as the filing date.
Explained: Why Reliance's bonus issue left brokerages unimpressedIt may be noted that there was no word on the potential listing of RIL's two key businesses—Reliance Jio and Reliance Retail.

Paytm shares rise over 12% today: What should investors do?This rise in shares comes amid important developments within the company, including the recent sale of its entertainment ticketing business to online food aggregator Zomato for Rs 2,048 crore.

Simplified pension form launched for retiring government staff. Check detailsThe new form consolidates nine separate forms into a single, unified Form 6A. It also offers the option to download the ePPO, ensuring a seamless transition from employment to retirement.
Sensex, Nifty end higher as investors await Q1 GDP data; RVNL up 4%The S&P BSE Sensex rose 231.16 points to 82,365.77, while the NSE NIfty50 settled 83.95 higher at 25,235.90.

India Q1 GDP growth preview: What to watch out for Analysts predict growth in the range of 6%-7.1% for Q1 FY25, compared with 7.8% in the previous quarter (Q4 FY24). Rating agencies and financial institutions have varying expectations for Q1 GDP growth.
RVNL shares cross Rs 600 mark after jumping 5%. What's behind the rally?Shares of this multibagger railway PSU have sharply corrected over the past month but are still up over 230% year-to-date.

Reliance bonus issue: What is it and how will it benefit shareholders?A bonus issue, also known as a bonus share issue, occurs when a company distributes additional shares to its existing shareholders at no cost to them.

'Jan Dhan Yojana pivotal in boosting financial inclusion': PM ModiSpeaking at the Global Fintech Fest (GFF), he mentioned how the scheme has been a game-changer in ensuring that banking services reach every corner of the country.

UK's Aviva found guilty in $26 million fake invoice scandal in India: ReportBritish insurer Aviva has been accused of violating regulations in India by using fake invoices and secret cash payments to bypass commission limits for sales agents.

Vistara-Air India merger: Check impact on ticket bookings, flight operations and moreVistara-Air India merger: Travelers can expect expanded services and improved connectivity. Read on to see how this change will impact your bookings, flight operations, and travel experience.

No Vistara flight bookings from September 3 ahead of merger with Air IndiaVistara-Air India merger: Starting from September 3, 2024, customers will no longer be able to book Vistara flights for travel on or after November 12, 2024. Bookings for these routes will be redirected to Air India's website.

Premier Energies IPO allotment: Step-by-step guide to check status Premier Energies IPO allotment: Investors can check their Premier Energies IPO allotment status online via the BSE website or Kfin Technologies Limited, the issue's registrar.
Sensex, Nifty rally to new peaks as Moody's revises India's growth forecast to 7.2%Sensex, Nifty rally to new peaks as Moody's revises India's growth forecast to 7.2%
Sensex, Nifty open at record highs as Moody's lifts India's GDP forecast to 7.2%The S&P BSE Sensex added 502.42 points to 82,637.03, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 87.45 points to 25,239.40.

RIL AGM: Mukesh Ambani bullish on Reliance's growth; no word on Jio, Retail IPOsMukesh Ambani was bullish on the conglomerate's growth and said that Reliance was on track to more than double in size before the end of this decade.

Shah Rukh Khan enters Hurun India Rich List with Rs 7,300 crore net worthKnown for his recent hits like 'Jawan' and 'Pathaan', Khan's wealth isn't just from his successful film career but also from his stakes in the IPL team, Kolkata Knight Riders, which have significantly increased in value.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Haryana election postponed to October 5, counting of votes on October 8The Election Commission has also revised the counting day for both Haryana and Jammu and Kashmir Assembly elections from October 4 to October 8.

Paralympics: Rubina wins bronze as Indian shooters continue to shine in ParisIndia's Rubina Francis won bronze to bring home the 5th medal for India in the Paris Paralympics on Saturday, 31 August. Rubina put in an incredible effort to win a medal in the women's 10m air pistol SH1 event.

Man assaulted on Nashik train over suspicion of carrying beefA video of the incident was shared by AIMIM MP Imtiaz Jaleel, who called out the government and police for turning a bling eye against 'these forces'.

NorthEast win first title after beating Mohun Bagan in Durand Cup finalNorthEast United FC won their first-ever major title after clinching their well-deserved Durand Cup 2024 with a comeback win against defending champions Mohun Bagan Super Giants in the high-value final on August 29 via penalties.

India's IPO frenzy: Why companies are rushing to go publicIn the first half of 2024, while global IPO markets cooled, India's IPO market has been on fire, bucking the trend seen in the US, Japan, and even China.
4 Mumbai cops caught on CCTV planting 'drugs' on man, all suspendedMumbai Police has suspended four cops after viral CCTV footage purportedly showed them planting drugs on a man during a raid.

Audi owner who slammed cab driver to ground arrested by Mumbai PoliceA video which went viral on social media showed the Audi owner throwing the 24-year-old cab driver onto the ground after a minor collision of their cars in Mumbai's Ghatkopar.

Mohanlal breaks silence on Hema panel report: 'Don't destroy Malayalam industry'Malayalam actor Mohanlal made his first public appearance on August 31 after resigning as president of the Association of Malayalam Movie Artists (AMMA). He spoke about the Hema Committee report and assured that those responsible would be punished.

How subtitles now decide the fate of filmsSubtitles have played a significant role in breaking language barriers, expanding audience reach, and changing viewing habits across India's diverse linguistic landscape.
UP man converts woman, uses her money to travel abroad, gives her talaqA man in Lucknow allegedly lied about his religion to deceive a woman, forced her to convert, and later gave her 'triple talaq'.

Fish extract in Patanjali's 'vegetarian' product? Court notice to Ramdev, CentreThe petition alleges that the packaging of Patanjali's Divya Manjan features a green dot, a symbol indicating vegetarian products, yet the list of ingredients clearly shows that the tooth powder contains 'samudraphen', which is derived from fish extract.

Need faster verdicts: PM Modi on crimes against women amid Kolkata rape-murderAmid the outrage over the Kolkata rape-murder, Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Saturday said that the country needs faster verdicts in cases of crimes against women to ensure their safety.

Will Champai Soren give an edge or headache to BJP?Former JMM leader Champai Soren, a former aide of the Soren family, joined the BJP on Friday, ahead of the Assembly polls in Jharkhand. Champai Soren will give the BJP an edge in the tribal Assembly seats of Santhal and Kolhan regions, but might bring headaches to a party overloaded with leaders.

Haryana polls: Battle for Dalit vote heats up as Mayawati, Chandrasekhar enter frayAs the Haryana Assembly elections approach, the battle for the Dalit vote intensifies with both the Bahujan Samaj Party and the Azad Samaj Party entering the fray.

After a rainy August, how will the weather be in September?India is set for above-normal rainfall in September 2024, with warmer temperatures expected across most regions, influenced by emerging La Nina conditions.

Migrant killed in Haryana on suspicion of eating beef, 2 minors among 7 arrestedHaryana lynching: Five people, including two minors, have been arrested for the incident that happened in Haryana's Charkhi Dadri district.

How Jahangir fell for British charm and paved the way for India's colonisationJahangir's reign, a tapestry of indulgence and leisure, allowed the British East India Company to weave its threads into India's fabric. Enchanted by England's curiosities and distracted by his own pleasures, the emperor's gaze faltered, paving the way for 200 years of British dominance.

Vinesh Phogat joins farmers' stir at Shambhu border: Your daughter is with youOlympian Vinesh Phogat was honoured with garlands as the wrestler joined the farmers' protest at Sambhu border today.

Why Kamala Harris wants Trump unmutedFor their first presidential debate on September 10, Democratic Presidential candidate Kamala Harris wants her Republican rival Donald Trump's mic unmuted. Trump is saying that the matter has been settled, but the Harris campaign is insisting on an unmuted mic for the candidates. Here's why.

Bahraich Bottomline: The Indian wolf is no man-eaterThe Indian wolf is the most ancient lineage of living wolves in the world. Having evolved in the Indian sub-continent, it has as much right as us to live and thrive in India. But it is not thriving.

Paralympics 2024 Day 3 Live: Sheetal Devi's run ends, Sarita up next in actionParalympics 2024 Day 3 Live: India's armless para-archery phenomena, Sheetal Devi missed out on a Paralympics quarter-final spot after losing the 1/8 elimination round. Para shooter Rubina Francis wins bronze in women's 10m Air Pistol final SH1. Nitesh Kumar also began with a win, beating Thailand's Mongkhon Bunsun in straight games. Sunkant Kadam is the latest to reach the semi-finals in the SL4 category.

INS Arighaat: How a second nuclear submarine boosts India's strategic reachThe presence of both INS Arihant and INS Arighaat will enhance India's capability to deter potential adversaries and safeguard its national interests.

Caught on camera: Man flung into air after car rams him in MaharashtraA Maharashtra man suffered severe injuries in a hit-and-run incident when a speeding car struck him from behind, throwing him into the air.

'Matta' song: Fourth track from Vijay Thalapathy's 'GOAT' outThalapathy Vijay's new song 'Matta' from 'The Greatest of All Time' is out, featuring contributions from Yuvan Shankar Raja and others, promising to captivate audiences with vibrant vocals and dance moves.

'Sanam Teri Kasam' 2 in works, but without Harshvardhan Rane, Mawra Hocane?The romantic drama 'Sanam Teri Kasam' is getting a sequel titled 'Jaanam Teri Kasam', but without the original lead actors Harshvardhan Rane and Mawra Hocane.

Dia Mirza recalls heartbreak after 'Rehnaa Hai Terre Dil Mein' failureThe Bollywood film 'Rehnaa Hai Terre Dil Mein' has been re-released in theatres after 23 years. To commemorate it, lead actors Dia Mirza and R Madhavan went down the memory lane and revealed their reaction after the film's initial failure.

Nicole Kidman's 'Babygirl' gets standing ovation at Venice Film Festival Nicole Kidman's erotic thriller 'Babygirl' received a standing ovation at the Venice Film Festival. A video of the event is circulating widely on social media.

sports.headline: Watch: Joe Root shares hug with father after record century vs Sri LankaJoe Root's heartfelt embrace with his father at Lord's after his record-breaking century captured the emotional depth of his achievement, as he surpassed Alastair Cook to become England's all-time leading Test century-maker.

Gautam Gambhir as India coach: Jonty Rhodes unfazed by mixed startJonty Rhodes has said he is unfazed by the mixed start Gautam Gambhir has made as the coach of the Indian cricket team. Gambhir had lost the ODI series after winning 3 T20Is against Sri Lanka in his first assignment.

World-class Babar Azam will score big runs again, says Salman AghaPAK vs BAN, 2nd Test: Pakistan batting all-rounder Salman Agha has backed Babar Azam to score runs again. In the first innings, Babar got out for 31 runs, his 15th innings without a fifty in Test cricket.

ENG vs SL: Joe Root breaks Alastair Cook's record with 34th Test hundredJoe Root scored his 34th Test century to go to the top of the all-time list for England batters to score hundreds in the format. Babar Azam's poor form continues after steep ICC ranking slipPAK vs BAN, 2nd Test: Pakistan batter Babar Azam's poor form continued in Test cricket just days later after his steep fall in the ICC rankings. Babar batted for 77 balls in the 1st innings of the second Test and got out after scoring 31 runs.

On This Day, 10 years ago: Birth of Kohli, Root, Smith and Kane as 'Fab Four' On 31st August in 2014, Martin Crowe introduced the term 'Fab Four' which included the star players like Virat Kohli, Joe Root, Steve Smith and Kane Williamson.

Popyrin said that he had played Djokovic this season in the Australian Open and at the Wimbledon and knew that he could beat the defending champion.

Novak Djokovic rues playing 'worst tennis in years' after US Open 2024 exitNovak Djokovic rued playing 'worst tennis in years' after his third round exit from US Open 2024. The 24-time Grand Slam winner felt 'out of gas' after his Olympic gold medal win in Paris.

Chennai all set to witness supercars vroom in F4 and IRL night street racingChennai City is all set to witness the Night Street racing from 31st August to 1st September in F4 and Indian Racing League.

After historic midnight win, Aryna Sabalenka thanks crowd for staying lateAryna Sabalenka reached the round of 16 of the US Open with a historic midnight win over Ekaterina Alexandrova. She thanked the crowd for staying till late.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
